node.statement: PHI_N FORMULA AND PARTIAL FRACTION IDENTITY: Substituting the result of Step 1.4.4 into the definition of Phi_n: Phi_n(r) = sum_{i=1}^n H_r(lambda_i)^2 = sum_{i=1}^n [(1/2) * sum_{k=1}^{n-1} 1/(lambda_i - gamma_k)]^2 = (1/4) * sum_{i=1}^n [sum_{k=1}^{n-1} 1/(lambda_i - gamma_k)]^2. COROLLARY (Partial fraction identity): Since we also have H_r(lambda_i) = sum_{j!=i} 1/(lambda_i - lambda_j) by the definition of the discrete Hilbert transform, equating the two expressions gives the identity: sum_{j=1, j!=i}^n 1/(lambda_i - lambda_j) = (1/2) * sum_{k=1}^{n-1} 1/(lambda_i - gamma_k) for each i = 1, ..., n. This identity is independently verifiable via the partial fraction decomposition of r'(x)/r(x) = sum_i 1/(x - lambda_i).
